name: hc_marine_gdmi_sf_pivot
description: [HC] Ship + GDMI-SF ‚Üí BLOCK (Ej i Rostfritt), pivot GDB-SF+insulation
query: Ship installation. We require insulation and Syrafast stainless (SF). Please provide GDMI-SF.

turns.content: Ship installation. We require insulation and Syrafast stainless (SF). Please provide GDMI-SF.

This marine/offshore installation is subject to Salt Spray, Outdoor Condensation, and High Humidity. Salt spray accelerates corrosion, high humidity reduces service life, and outdoor condensation can form on non-insulated surfaces.Unfortunately, the GDMI family is not suitable for marine environments due to its C3 corrosion resistance rating. Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance. The bolted construction of the GDMI housing does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.Additionally, SF (Syrafast Rostfri St√•lpl√•t / Acid-proof Stainless Steel) is not available for the GDMI product family. Available materials are Aluzink AZ185 and Zinkmagnesium ZM310.No standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance and a welded construction to meet leakage and hygiene requirements. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.To proceed with specifying the GDP protector stage, I need two details:What are the filter dimensions for the GDP protector stage?What is the required airflow?

gemini.explanation: The system correctly blocked the request due to material unavailability and environmental risks, demonstrating excellent safety and constraint adherence. However, it contained a factual error regarding the corrosion class of the GDMI family (stating C3 instead of C4) and pivoted to asking about a different product (GDP) without explaining the transition.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system incorrectly stated GDMI has a C3 rating; the PDF (p.11) explicitly states 'Korrosivitets klass C4'.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the material and environment constraints fully but confusingly pivots to specifying a 'GDP protector stage' which was not requested.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly identifies that the standard product is not suitable for a marine environment (requires C5/SF) and blocks the unsafe configuration.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic: correctly identifies that marine environments require C5/Stainless, and since the product doesn't offer it, the application is blocked.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the PDF constraint 'Ej i Rostfritt' (Not in Stainless) for the GDMI family (p.11).

strengths: Correctly identified that GDMI is not available in Stainless/SF (PDF p.11 'Ej i Rostfritt').
Appropriate safety blocking for marine environment requirements.
Good advice to contact custom engineering for non-standard requirements.
weaknesses: Factual error: Claimed GDMI is C3 class (PDF says C4).
Confusing pivot to asking for GDP parameters without context.
pdf_citations: GDMI: 'Korrosivitets klass C4' (PDF p.11) - System claimed C3
GDMI: 'Ej i Rostfritt' (PDF p.11) - Verified system claim that SF is unavailable

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that GDMI does not offer SF material per the catalog, but it incorrectly states GDMI is only C3 and adds unsupported claims about bolted construction, leakage class, and hygiene requirements for marine use. It also pivots to a GDP ‚Äúprotector stage‚Äù without the user requesting it, and blocks the request too aggressively given the catalog‚Äôs stated C5/C5.1 material options.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correct that GDMI standard material is AZ (example: ‚ÄúGDMI-600x600-600-R-PG-AZ‚Äù) and the catalog does not list SF for GDMI, but incorrect to claim GDMI is C3‚Äîcatalog states GDMI is typically ZM (and not stainless) with corrosion class C4, and the material page lists SF as C5.1 (PDF material section).
dimension_explanations.completeness: It does not ask for key selection inputs (size WxH, length 600/850, connection PG vs flange, door handing) and introduces an unrelated GDP stage request.
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately highlights marine salt-spray/high-humidity corrosion risk and avoids recommending a non-available SF GDMI configuration.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, with clear explanation and a reasonable escalation path to technical support.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Cause-effect corrosion reasoning is generally sound, but it contains logical leaps (marine hygiene/leakage requirements, welded vs bolted necessity) not supported by the provided catalog data.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates catalog constraints by misclassifying GDMI‚Äôs corrosion class/material capability (calling it C3) and over-blocks based on non-catalog ‚Äòwelded required‚Äô constraints.

strengths: Correctly identifies that SF (acid-proof stainless) is not offered for GDMI in the catalog examples/material indications.
Flags marine corrosion drivers (salt spray, humidity, condensation) and avoids an unsafe material recommendation.
weaknesses: Factual error on GDMI corrosion class/material rating (claims C3) and adds unsupported leakage/hygiene/welded-construction requirements.
Asks for GDP protector-stage details that were not requested and omits basic GDMI selection clarifications (size, length, connection, access side).
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h (GDB M√ÖTT table, PDF).
GDMI example designation shows material AZ: ‚ÄúGDMI-600x600-600-R-PG-AZ‚Äù and GDMI text states typically ZM (not stainless) with corrosion class C4 (GDMI section, PDF).

anthropic.explanation: The system makes multiple factual errors: GDMI is rated C4 (not C3 as claimed), and the system incorrectly blocks the entire request based on fabricated marine environment assumptions when the user said 'ship installation' but asked specifically for SF material. The PDF explicitly states GDMI is available in AZ and ZM only (not RF/SF), which is correct, but the reasoning chain around corrosion class and 'welded construction' requirements is not grounded in catalog data.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDMI is rated C4 per PDF p.11 ('Korrosivitets klass C4'), not C3 as the system claims; SF material unavailability for GDMI is correct per PDF (only AZ/ZM listed), but the C3 claim is a factual error.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system correctly identifies SF is unavailable for GDMI and suggests contacting custom engineering, but fails to suggest alternative product families (GDB or GDC) that DO support SF material per the PDF.
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly flags marine environment concerns and blocks an unsuitable configuration, but the reasoning is based on incorrect corrosion class data and fabricated 'welded construction' requirements not found in the catalog.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative tone appropriate for technical sales engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The system fabricates a 'C3' rating for GDMI (actually C4), invents 'welded construction' requirements for marine environments not in the catalog, and introduces 'hygiene requirements for marine environments' without basis ‚Äî the logic chain contains multiple unsupported claims.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly blocks SF for GDMI (not available), but incorrectly states C3 rating and fabricates construction type constraints; should have redirected to GDB-SF or GDC-SF which support SF material per the PDF.

strengths: Correctly identifies that SF (Syrafast) is not available for the GDMI product family ‚Äî only AZ and ZM are listed
Appropriately suggests contacting custom engineering when no standard product meets all requirements
weaknesses: States GDMI has C3 corrosion resistance when the PDF clearly states C4 (Korrosivitets klass C4, p.11)
Fails to suggest alternative product families like GDB or GDC that DO support SF material (all five material options FZ/AZ/RF/SF/ZM are shown for GDB p.8 and GDC p.14)
Fabricates 'welded construction' and 'hygiene requirements for marine environments' constraints not found anywhere in the catalog
Assumes marine environment details (salt spray, outdoor condensation) without confirming ‚Äî 'ship installation' could mean various things and the system should have clarified
pdf_citations: GDMI: 'Korrosivitets klass C4' (PDF p.11) ‚Äî system incorrectly claims C3
GDMI material options: AZ and ZM only (PDF p.11, material icons show only AZ and ZM)
GDB material options: FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM (PDF p.8, all five material icons shown)
GDC material options: FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM (PDF p.14, all five material icons shown)

content_segments.text: This marine/offshore installation is subject to Salt Spray, Outdoor Condensation, and High Humidity. Salt spray accelerates corrosion, high humidity reduces service life, and outdoor condensation can form on non-insulated surfaces.

Unfortunately, the GDMI family is not suitable for marine environments due to its C3 corrosion resistance rating. Marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance. The bolted construction of the GDMI housing does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.
Additionally, SF (Syrafast Rostfri St√•lpl√•t / Acid-proof Stainless Steel) is not available for the GDMI product family. Available materials are Aluzink AZ185 and Zinkmagnesium ZM310.

No standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance and a welded construction to meet leakage and hygiene requirements. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
To proceed with specifying the GDP protector stage, I need two details:
What are the filter dimensions for the GDP protector stage?
